author: AP and Network Writers
title: Cheers and West Wing star Roger Rees dies aged 71 | The
text:
ROGER Rees, the lanky Tony Award-winning Welsh-born actor who starred in Cheers and The West Wing, has died aged 71.
Rees died on Friday night at his home in New York after a brief illness, said his representative, Rick Miramontez.
Roger Rees in Cheers!
Rees had abruptly left The Visit on Broadway in late May to undergo a medical procedure.
Rees played the snobbish Robin Colcord on TV’s Cheers - he was known for his condescending remarks and rivalry with Sam Malone and for dating Rebecca Howe - and the British ambassador, Lord John Marbury, in The West Wing .
Fan favourite ... Roger Rees with the cast of Cheers. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
Other recent TV credits include Elementary and The Good Wife .
But he was probably best known onstage for playing the title character in the Royal Shakespeare Company’s original production of Charles Dickens’ The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby in England and on Broadway. He won an Olivier Award and then a Tony. When it was adapted to TV, he earned an Emmy Award nomination.
Funnyman ... Roger Rees as Lord John Marbury in The West Wing, alongside the late John Spencer. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
He earned two further Tony nominations in 1995 for Indiscretions and in 2012 for co-directing Peter and the Starcatcher , a Peter Pan prequel.
Other Broadway roles were in The Winslow Boy, The Addams Family, Uncle Vanya, The Rehearsal, The Red Shoes and London Assurance .
Married ... Roger Rees, left, and husband Rick Elice started dating in 1982 and were married in 2011. Picture: Splash Source: Supplied
Born in Aberystwyth, Wales, in 1944, he spent more than two decades with the Royal Shakespeare Company and served as the artistic director of the Williamstown Theatre Festival in Massachusetts from 2004 to 2007.
He was also the associate artistic director of the Bristol Old Vic in England for two years starting in 1985.
Down Under ... Sir Ian McKellen and Roger Rees at The Comedy Theatre in Melbourne’s production of Waiting For Godot. Picture: Supplied Source: News Limited
In film, Rees played the Sheriff of Rottingham in Mel Brooks’ Robin Hood: Men in Tights in 1993 and was in The Scorpion King in 2002 and The Pink Panther in 2006.
He is survived by his husband Rick Elice, the playwright, whose credits include the Peter Pan prequel Peter and the Starcatcher , which Rees co-directed.
Tributes have streamed in from his former co-stars and those who knew him.
Brilliant actor, dear friend and colleague, witty, kind, private man, Roger Rees died this morning. A space is left that cannot be filled.
— Patrick Stewart (@SirPatStew) July 11, 2015 RIP #RogerRees best known as Robin Colcord from Cheers,The West Wing and theatre. Seen here with @kirstiealley pic.twitter.com/nQSxu04kzY
— Audrey Hepburn (@SoAudreyHepburn) July 11, 2015 R.I.P. Roger Rees. A true gentleman. A class act. A genuine man & brilliant actor. He will be missed. All my love to Rick & his loved ones.
— Jesse Tyler Ferguson (@jessetyler) July 11, 2015 Roger Rees. You will be missed. I'll always remember our time at Williamstown fondly. Rest In Peace, Roger.
— Emmy Rossum (@emmyrossum) July 11, 2015 So sad to hear the news of Roger Rees' passing. He was a marvelous talent. My thoughts go out to his loved ones. I was always a such a fan.
— Darren Criss (@DarrenCriss) July 11, 2015 Originally published as Cheers and West Wing star dies
